item.text: The Israelites again did evil in the Lord’s sight after Ehud’s death.
The Lord turned them over to King Jabin of Canaan, who ruled in Hazor. The general of his army was Sisera, who lived in Harosheth Haggoyim.
The Israelites cried out for help to the Lord because Sisera had 900 chariots with iron-rimmed wheels, and he cruelly oppressed the Israelites for 20 years.
Now Deborah, a prophetess, wife of Lappidoth, was leading Israel at that time.
She would sit under the Date Palm Tree of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the Ephraimite hill country. The Israelites would come up to her to have their disputes settled.

She summoned Barak son of Abinoam from Kedesh in Naphtali. She said to him, “Is it not true that the Lord God of Israel is commanding you? Go, march to Mount Tabor! Take with you 10,000 men from Naphtali and Zebulun.

I will <st data-num="04900" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="05516" class="">Sisera</st>, the <st data-num="08269" class="">general</st> of <st data-num="02985" class="">Jabin’s</st> <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="07028" class="">Kishon</st> <st data-num="05158" class="">River</st>, along with his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="01995" class="">huge army</st>.<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="05414 ">hand</st> him <st data-num="03027" class="">over</st> to you.”

<st data-num="01301" class="">Barak</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> me, I will <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>. But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> you do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> me, I will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>.”
She said, “I will indeed go with you. But you will not gain fame on the expedition you are undertaking, for the Lord will turn Sisera over to a woman.” Deborah got up and went with Barak to Kedesh.

<st data-num="01301" class="">Barak</st> <st data-num="02199" class="">summoned</st> men from <st data-num="02074" class="">Zebulun</st> and <st data-num="05321" class="">Naphtali</st> to <st data-num="06943" class="">Kedesh</st>, and <st data-num="06235 0505" class="">10,000</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">followed</st> <st data-num="07272">him</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01683" class="">Deborah</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him as well.
Now Heber the Kenite had moved away from the Kenites, the descendants of Hobab, Moses’ father-in-law. He lived near the great tree in Zaanannim near Kedesh.
When Sisera heard that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor,

<st data-num="05516" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02199" class="">ordered</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariotry</st>—<st data-num="08672 03967" class="">900</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> with <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st>-rimmed wheels—and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">troops</st> he <st data-num="0834" class="">had</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him to go from <st data-num="02800" class="">Harosheth</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">Haggoyim</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07028" class="">Kishon</st> <st data-num="05158" class="">River</st>.

Deborah said to Barak, “Spring into action, for this is the day the Lord is handing Sisera over to you! Has the Lord not taken the lead?” So Barak went down from Mount Tabor with 10,000 men following him.
The Lord routed Sisera, all his chariotry, and all his army with the edge of the sword. Sisera jumped out of his chariot and ran away on foot.
Now Barak chased the chariots and the army all the way to Harosheth Haggoyim. Sisera’s whole army died by the edge of the sword; not even one survived!
Now Sisera ran away on foot to the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite, for King Jabin of Hazor and the family of Heber the Kenite had made a peace treaty.

<st data-num="03278" class="">Jael</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">came out</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">welcome</st> <st data-num="05516" class="">Sisera</st>. She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="05493" class="">Stop and rest</st>,<n id="1" /> my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st>. <st data-num="05493" class="">Stop and rest</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> me. <st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st>.” So Sisera<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05493" class="">stopped to rest</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">in</st> her <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st>, and she <st data-num="03680" class="">put</st> a <st data-num="08063" class="">blanket</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">over</st> him.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="08248 04994">Give</st> me a <st data-num="04592" class="">little</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="08248 04994">to drink</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> I’m <st data-num="06770" class="">thirsty</st>.” She <st data-num="06605" class="">opened</st> a <st data-num="04997" class="">goatskin container</st> of <st data-num="02461" class="">milk</st> and <st data-num="08248" class="">gave</st> him some milk <st data-num="08248" class="">to drink</st>. Then she <st data-num="03680" class="">covered</st> him <st data-num="03680" class="">up</st> again.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="05975" class="">Stand</st> watch at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st>. <st data-num="01961 0518">If</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">anyone</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">comes</st> along and <st data-num="07592 0559">asks</st> you, ‘Is <st data-num="03426" class="">there</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="06311" class="">here</st>?’ <st data-num="0559" class="">say,</st> ‘<st data-num="0369" class="">No</st>.’”

Then <st data-num="03278" class="">Jael</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> of <st data-num="02268" class="">Heber</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> a <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> <st data-num="03489" class="">peg</st> in one hand <st data-num="07760" class="">and</st> a <st data-num="04718" class="">hammer</st> in the <st data-num="03027" class="">other</st>.<n id="1" /> She <st data-num="0935 03909">crept up</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> him, <st data-num="08628" class="">drove</st> the <st data-num="03489" class="">tent peg</st> through his <st data-num="07541" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="06795" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st><n id="2" /> while <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="07290" class="">was asleep</st> from <st data-num="05774" class="">exhaustion</st>,<n id="3" /> and he <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>.

Now Barak was chasing Sisera. Jael went out to welcome him. She said to him, “Come here and I will show you the man you are searching for.” He went with her into the tent, and there he saw Sisera sprawled out dead with the tent peg through his temple.
That day God humiliated King Jabin of Canaan before the Israelites.
Israel’s power continued to overwhelm King Jabin of Canaan until they did away with him.
